reviews.text: Having read other reviews here, I was concerned that all might not be "in order" when my party of three adults arrived at the Hotel Bigallo. NO NEED for concern. The hotel was expecting us; the desk clerk was helpful in guiding us in getting our luggage up the one interior stairway we had to nagivate; and the room was charming. There was a roomy loft comfortably sleeping two, and my bed was downstairs - a perfectly comfortable daybed. One desk clerk, the one who was there as we arrived, was especially charming and helpful. She was most complimentary of my poor but earnest Italian language skills. Her English was impeccable.
reviews.title: A Delightful Stay
Not bad......
reviews.text: Our room absolutely defined "Room with a view." The location is way beyond ideal; and street noise was never a problem despite the hotel's location at the heart of busy, tourist-swarmed Florence. Even though Breakfast was just OK -- cold cereal, cold cuts, cheese and bread -- I would certainly stay there again. Some rooms might not have such a grand view -- but this one sure did!

reviews.title: A fraud
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location....directly across from the duomo. It's a small hotel and has continential style breakfast every morning. It was clean and had cute European feel about the place...the only down side was it was very noisy outside (the Duomo attracts big crowds, the piazza has tons of people). We could hear the noise even when the windows were closed at night....people were out until 1am or longer. It was a good place to stay, but if you want quiet evenings, I would choose another place.

reviews.title: Fraud and Unethical
reviews.text: We too had the same experience. We booked this hotel after the good reviews on trip advisor but we were extremely disappointed when we arrived to find it was not open. We were moved to a different hotel, which was of a much lower standard. We would not have stayed in this hotel if we had not arrived so late in the day. Despite asking on a number of occassions, nobody seemed to know why we had been moved. I would be interested to know if anybody does get to stay in Hotel Bigallo, and if it is still of the same standard as the reviews suggest.

reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for our recent visit to Florence. When we first arrived in the city, we called to get direction. The lady who answered the phone represented herself as from Hotel Bigallo. She was very courteous and gave us perfect direction to the hotel. The nightmare began when we arrived at the front door of the hotel. She told us that the hotel was closed and that she would take us to another property nearby (a much worst one). We were so puzzled, and disappointed. But given the short notice from her, it would be impossible to look for another hotel at the spot. We had no choice but to go with her.

reviews.title: Awesome location! Service not great...
reviews.text: I only gave the Bigallo 4 out of 5 because of service. It seems a recurring theme. The service by the front desk staff is not horrible, just not overly helpful. Mailing a postcard became a big job.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: However the location is PERFECT! Literally accross the street from the Duomo. Noise was not a problem at all. We too had a two level room and it worked out pretty well. Breakfast is adequate, but I would definitely stay here again based on the location - less than 10 minute easy walk to anything in Florence.

By the way, one of the previous reviews referenced Restaurant Bibo. We also got sent there and it was good and not overly expensive. We arrived without a reservation and the manager or owner (??) apologized for not having a table right away and gave us complimentary glasses of Champagne.
reviews.title: Would certainly return

reviews.text: this is our second stay in italy and we have stayed at qiute a few hotels. first look at the size of the rooms you are staying in and the hallways in which they are putting the beds most of the beds in italy are all twins size and then fitted together to make a big bed it is just they way they do things over there I have had very few hotels including some of the four star hotels that have the full size beds. we were a bit shakey at first about his hotle we had just came from a bad experince in siena with a four star hotel that should have been a one star. so this three star hotel we weren't sure of. but I have to say it was one of the better hotels that we stayed at for the location and the view was sectacular. the service well much to be desired we asked for some good resturants and we were told bebo's yuck!! you would think that they would have known some good places we did get screwed with the go thru a tour guide thin for the uffiz but hey we got in they were booked for the prebooking for the next two days we booked it for that afternoon it was expensive but if you like looking at art it is worth it. I myself would have enjoyed a palace or two to look at rather than the paintings. breakfast more like your continental breakfast in the states bread and coffee items not much. every thing is new and clean and the bathroom has a tub and shower. I cannot say enough about the room it had a loft to the bed room area so romantic and the view breathtaking!! the staff wasn't rude just not as helpful as the four and five star hotels that we had been to but for sure not rude!! we stayed in 1404 awsome view with air
reviews.title: Great location, poor service
GREAT VIEWS FROM ROOM
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bigallo 9-15-04 to 9-20-04, and found it to be wonderful. The staff was very friendly, but they may be a bit apprehensive about their English, which is actually quite good. This may account for the "attitude" others discribe. The rooms are large by European standards, and the location and view are outstanding. We were in room 1302 which appeared recently re-done. Modern, large windows with sound proofing, good air conditioning, large bathroom, room safe, hair dryer, and sufficient breakfast of rolls, cheese juice, coffee, etc.

We based our trip on feedback from other trip advisor comments. It worked out great. Excellent location looking out at the Duomo. We had a hard time finding it as it is in a very small alleyway off the main street. Very clean and well maintained. Front desk help were helpful, but not overly friendly. Only draw back I can think of are the church bells going off at 7:15am (I think) and 8:15am. Did not pose too much of a problem as we wanted to get up and going early. We did not have to pay cash (as noted be other trip advisor post).
reviews.title: The BEST location!

reviews.text: i give this place an A+ because of location, cleanliness and value. the holy trinity of travel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Price

reviews.text: i would go back there at any time, its about 20 yards from the duomo, just an amazing location.
reviews.title: SUPERIOR Location - nice and clean

reviews.text: I would definately reccommend this hotel to others. The Location in Florence is fabulous - right in the middle of the town and located literally across from the Duomo (Large church - one of the main attractions in Florence).
reviews.title: Great location and value
Great location. Clean and elegant duplex room
reviews.text: Make sure to ask for a room with a view (you can email them with this request) because from your window you have a spectacular view of the Duomo and at night it is beautiful. It is a little noisey because you are in the middle of town and you will hear the church bells, etc. BUT they have wood window panels that close completely and block out almost all the noise.
If you want close to inexpensive and convenience, it's the place for you.
reviews.title: Close to the Duomo

likes.liked: — The desk clerk in the afternoons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is verrrrrry hard to find, even with directions. You enter in an alley way off a main street.
reviews.title: Hole in the Wall
Fantastic stay at Hotel Bigallo
reviews.text: We were 4 and the rooms were adequate. The woman who checed us in was very inhospitable.

reviews.title: Gem of a hotel in the heart of Florence, Italy
reviews.text: Our room had a decent view of the Duomo and we were glad to lay down at the end of the day, until we hit the mushy mattresses. The bathrooms were very cramped. When you sat on the "pot", your legs were in the shower (which is ok if you want to do two things at once).

reviews.title: Fantastic Location
reviews.text: Ok breakfast; the best thing about the place was the young man who had the afternoon shift. He gave us two great recommendations of restaurants (one was 4 stars in Fodor's which we overheard after we were eating there). He made reservations and called us cabs. I wish I knew his name but he was the only good thing about Hotel Bigallo (it is pronounced Big Gallo like the wine, not bigalo like a gigalo).
